00010 /**
00011  * routines for super simple pattern parsing
00012  * @package kata_utility
00013  * @author feldkamp@gameforge.de
00014  */
00015  class SimpleparseUtility {
00016 
00017     /**
00018      * cut out a text depending on a searchpattern.
00019      * example: text is "abcdefghij",
00020      *          searchpattern is "ab*fg",
00021      *          then result is "cde"
00022      *
00023      * @param string $text text to search in
00024      * @param string $pattern pattern to search in text
00025      * @return mixed false when nothing is found, otherwise an array with text-results
00026      */
00027     public function getPattern($text, $pattern, $casesensitive= true) {
00028         if ($text === false) {
00029             $text= $this->_http->getBody();
00030         }
00031         $pattern= explode("*", $pattern);
00032 
00033         if ($casesensitive) {
00034             $x1= strpos($text, $pattern[0]);
00035         } else {
00036             $x1= stripos($text, $pattern[0]);
00037         }
00038         if ($x1 === false) {
00039             return false;
00040         }
00041 
00042         if ($casesensitive) {
00043             $x2= strpos($text, $pattern[1], $x1);
00044         } else {
00045             $x2= stripos($text, $pattern[1], $x1);
00046         }
00047         if ($x2 === false) {
00048             return false;
00049         }
00050 
00051         return substr($text, $x1 +strlen($pattern[0]), $x2 - $x1 -strlen($pattern[0]));
00052     }
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * cut out text depending on pattern, multiple wildcards allowed
00056  * example: text is "abcdefghij",
00057  *          searchpattern is "ab*fg*ij",
00058  *          then result is array("cde","h")
00059  *
00060  * @param string $text text to search in
00061  * @param string $pattern pattern to search in text
00062  * @return mixed false when nothing is found, otherwise an array with text-results
00063  */
00064     public function getPatterns($text, $pattern, $casesensitive= true) {
00065         $pattern= explode("*", $pattern);
00066         if (count($pattern)<2) {
00067             return false;
00068         }
00069         $out= array ();
00070         for ($i= 1; $i < count($pattern); $i++) {
00071             $temp= $this->getPattern($text, $pattern[$i -1].'*'.$pattern[$i], $casesensitive);
00072             if ($temp !== false) {
00073                 $out[]= $temp;
00074             }
00075         }
00076         return $out;
00077     }
00078 
00079 
00080 }
